channel.title: Moparscape awards
channel.description:
[img]http://i41.tinypic.com/1jrno3.png[/img] Given to the people that give the most help to other members. This award is pretty self explanatory. Its mainly for people who are on top of things and always helping others. By helping we mean almost completely resolving the problem to an extent no other user did in the topic (s). Note: This award is given by the amount of help you give thats noticed over time, not helping one person.
What an inefficient way to give out this award! The Server Help board is constantly flooded with at least 10 pages of help daily so how can the members who helped in older topics be noticed?

item.title: Moparscape awards
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:59, topic:341784”][quote author=Jc22493 link=topic=438184.msg3223083#msg3223083 date=1275341024]

DeathChaos9 needs this title, for obvious reasons.

iiLandon15 needs a ban, for destroying death’s chances.

@Davidi2 please gtfo my topic.

Adding to that, the staff aren’t going to give out an award to someone who has become active for a short amount of time only because the new awards were introduced.
[/quote]
We’ve only given them to people who were active before the award announcement.[/quote]
Yeah, that’s what I was saying.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape awards
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Si Force, post:39, topic:341784”]May I remind you all that when it comes to posts, it’s quality over quantity. We’re looking more at the quality of help they give, nobody cares about the amount of posts they may have in a board. (referring to “Server helper” award)[/quote]The person even admitted they haven’t helped as many people as others.

[quote=“Rixxx, post:40, topic:341784”][code=Java]package silabsoft;

class Her extends Kitchen implements Runnable {
public Object noob;
public Object pro;
public void run() {
boolean isCooking = false;
boolean isProgramming = false;
boolean newDish = false;
int COOKING_LEVEL = 0;
if (isCooking) {
if (newDish) {
// No longer making a sammich
COOKING_LEVEL += 1;
Her instanceof pro;
System.out.println(“She’s pro!”);
}
Her instanceof noob;
System.out.println(“Stop making me a sammich you stupid women!”);
} else { // is programming
isProgramming = true;
Her instanceof noob;
System.out.println(“Go make me a sammich!”);
}
}

}[/code]

edit: plz, java coder award?[/quote]fail troll is unsuccessful

[quote="`Aaron, post:43, topic:341784"]It seems that there is some controversy to the new awards.[/quote]Really?

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape awards
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:8, topic:341784”]Its not awarded for post count in the server help board. But for actually helping people and solving the problem, most people just suggest fixes and they dont know what they’re talking about. Jc was going topic to topic filling the entire board with his replys and answering all of the questions, and he always does this. This is why he was awarded with he Helper award. Just because you help people on simple compile errors doesn’t make you get it.

They’re basically the most knowledgeable about servers on the site along with being the most helpful. Somewhat of an expert if you will.[/quote]

Plenty of other people do that too

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape awards
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Fat Cookies, post:37, topic:341784”]i think i deserve java coder for my moparscape lulz method generator.

package ownd;

/**
 *
 * @author fc
 */
public class Main {

    public static String lolMethod() {

        String[] datatypes = {"byte", "boolean", "int", "short", "long", "float", "double", "char",
            "byte[]", "boolean[]", "int[]", "short[]", "long[]", "float[]", "double[]", "char[]",};
        
        String datatype = datatypes[(int) (Math.random() * datatypes.length)];
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();

        char[] letters = new char[26];
        for (int i = 0; i < letters.length; i++) {
            char a = 0x0;
            letters[i] = a += i + 97;
        }

        for (int i = 0; i < 26; i++) {
            sb.append(datatypes[(int) (Math.random() * datatypes.length)] + " " + letters[i] + ", ");
        }
        sb.deleteCharAt(sb.length() - 2);

        return "public static " + datatype + " lelMethod (" + sb.toString() + ") { }";
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
            System.out.println(lolMethod());
        }
    }
}

In seriousness, above average means you don’t produce shit code cough Davidi2 cough[/quote]wut

Read full topic

package ownd;

public class Main {

    public static String lolMethod() {

            "byte[]", "boolean[]", "int[]", "short[]", "long[]", "float[]", "double[]", "char[]",};
        
        String datatype = datatypes[(int) (Math.random() * datatypes.length)];
        StringBuilder sb = new StringBuilder();

        char[] letters = new char[26];
        for (int i = 0; i < letters.length; i++) {
            char a = 0x0;
            letters[i] = a += i + 97;
        }

        for (int i = 0; i < 26; i++) {
            sb.append(datatypes[(int) (Math.random() * datatypes.length)] + " " + letters[i] + ", ");
        }
        sb.deleteCharAt(sb.length() - 2);

        return "public static " + datatype + " lelMethod (" + sb.toString() + ") { }";
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        for (int i = 0; i < 10; i++) {
            System.out.println(lolMethod());
        }

}
